result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl R. Beck Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carl R. Beck Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Carl R. Beck Jr. was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Carl R. Beck Jr. was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AMENDED 02-20-2018:  Prison sentence imposed.  357 days credit.
AMENDED 05-08-2018:  7 days pre-sentence credit.  DOC will determine post sentence credit, namely for period after May 9, 2016.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Count 2

miscConds.notes: AMENDED 02-20-2018:  Ordered up to 50% of prison funds to be used to pay costs.

Concurrent with: Count 2

records.addlTxt: Letter from Mr. Beck
DOC - Notice of Status Change Slip - Revoked Sentenced to Prison

09:52 AM Defendant Carl R. Beck fails to appear.  Agent Larson appears for the Chippewa County DOC.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Beck requested huber release from incarceration on extended supervision.  State has no objection to huber release but he's already out on huber.  Mr. Beck is not on the call and Agent Larson and State discussed this matter and in his letter he wanted electronic monitoring and huber so not come back to the jail at night and the jail no longer offers electronic monitoring with COVID situation under control.  Court denies his request for electronic monitoring and proceed with status quo.
Hearing on July 13, 2021 at 09:45 am.

Partial Sentencing Transcript 2-20-2018
Count 1
Count 1

Defendant Carl R. Beck in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Defendant Carl R. Beck in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This is an Imposed & Stayed sentence, no hearing needed, however there is a sentence credit issue.  New PO Agent, perhaps confused and sent Revocation Order & Warrant packet; he was revoked from probation, impose sentence.  Court confirms sentence to 5 yrs. State Prison, 2 yrs. IC, 2 yrs. ES with conditions same as condition of probation; order up to 50% of prison funds to be used to pay costs; eligible for CIP & SAP.  Atty Randtke requests to clarify days credit listed in warrant and in revocation packet.  Off record to review credit.  Back on record.  Court determines 357 days credit; advises of appeal rights.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 20, 2018 at 02:15 pm.
Atty S. Joseph Randtke appt'd.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 20, 2018 at 09:30 am.
Letter from defendant requesting modification of sentence.  No response from Court.

Sentencing hearing on May 9, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Carl R. Beck in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Defendant Carl R. Beck in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel rec'd PSI & reviewed with his client, request continuance as was recently appointed, was previously represented by Atty Waters, need time to address if admitted to drug court.  Sign. Bond remains as set.  Referred to scheduling clerk for sentencing date @ 60 days out.

Order to Transport.
The warden/superintendent with physical custody of the person subject to this order at the time of its execution shall make that person available to the sheriff of Pepin County.  The sheriff shall convey that person to 740 7th Avenue West for proceedings in the Circuit Court of Pepin County on March 8, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.
Atty S. Joseph Randtke appt'd.
Sentencing hearing at 03-08-2016 11:00 am
Sentencing hearing at 01-19-2016 11:00 am

No possession or consumption of alcohol; 
No possession or consumption of controlled substance

Defendant Carl R. Beck in court in Pepin County.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin in Pepin County. Attorney Patrick William Waters appeared by phone means from Buffalo County Courtroom with Judge Duvall and court reporter.  State requests $5000 Cash Bond.  Atty Waters requests Sign. Bond, notes court issued an order to allow DOC to discontinue with PSI. Court will ask DOC to complete the PSI.  Sentencing to be reset for January.  Court sets $1000 Sign. Bond with conditions:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substance.  Defendant to update the COC with address and contact #.

Attorney Patrick William Waters in court.  Adam Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This is the time set for a plea/sentencing hrg., defendant FTA.   This hearing was set in June.  Warrant requested by the State & authorized by the Court.
Letter from Judge Duvall to Agent Krisik authorizing her to terminate her efforts to complete a DOC PSI.
Letter from DOC
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-15-2015 03:00 pm

Atty Waters waives formal reading of Information.  Court advises defendant of counts 1 & 2/max. penalties on each count and advises defendant of his constitutional rights.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1 & 2.  Court reviews PLQ/WOR form.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and pleas done knowingly & voluntary, accepts plea in count 1 & 2 and finds defendant guilty.  Dismiss count 3.  PSI ordered.  Referred to scheduling clerk for sentencing @ 60 days out.  Atty Waters addresses bond.  Defendant currently on VICAP, has had no violations, VICAP is expensive, and victim is still with him.  State objects.  Court modifies bond to remove the VICAP, no drinking, no bars remains in effect.

ADDRESS INFO for Carl R. Beck Jr.
Current: 11246 43rd Avenue, Chippewa Falls, WI 54729   (Effective: 06-16-2015)
Prior: 302 W Main Apt B, Durand, WI 54736 United States

Defendant Carl R. Beck in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Waters informs court of plea agreement, defendant will plead to count 1 & 2, count 3 DRI, State requests PSI.   Atty Waters files waiver of prelim. hrg. with court.  Court finds defendant WOPH done knowingly & voluntarily.  State informs the court requesting PSI based on defendant's criminal history.   Court notes Chippewa County Case No. 13CF08 a letter which may support Mr. Seifert's request for PSI.   Court now received the Information.
Atty Patrick Waters appt'd.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Carl R. Beck in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Waters informs the court defendant qualifies for SPD representation, requests the court remove the VICAP requirement as condition of bond due to change in financial situation, etc.  Court recalls pending charges against Mr. Beck.  State objects as defendant has pending felony charges, prior criminal convictions and without the VICAP unit he's a danger to community and this victim.  Court recalls the VICAP unit was a compromise of cash bond.  Bond remains as set.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Carl R. Beck Jr.
Current: 302 W Main Apt B, Durand, WI 54736 United States  (Effective: 05-12-2015)
Prior: 11246 43rd Avenue, Chippewa Falls, WI 54729

Court authorizes defendant may be released on cash bond or authorize signature bond if on monitored sobriety through VICAP unit and cooperate with Sheriff's Dept. with random drug testing and pay costs associated with it.

Defendant Carl R. Beck in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Defendant Carl R. Beck in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Waters requests Signature Bond.  State requests cash bond remain.  Court will allow defendant to post cash or authorize signature bond if on monitored sobriety through VICAP unit and cooperate with Sheriff's Dept. with random drug testing and pay costs of it.  Atty Waters informs the court with defendant doing this, he no longer can represent him as wouldn't qualify when not in custody.  Defendant requests not to schedule P.H. at this time so can contact an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Carl R. Beck in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights and right to preliminary hearing.  State requests $2500 cash bond.  Court sets bond at $2500 cash with conditions:  no drinking; no bars. Court open to some guarantee of no drinking.  Defendant  informed to contact SPD Office.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
No drinking; no entry into bars.
